notes.title: Hello World
notes.details:
• Attended Full Scale Learning Daily Checkpoint
	• Asked Sir Nax about the renewal of Javascript Certification in Hacker Rank
	• Started mini "notes" project where users could add notes on the application
	• Created structure and design of the application with excalidraw
	• Used Object Oriented Programming on creating the application
	• Created initial design of the application
Created functionality that will display and create new notes

notes.title: Something I Realized
notes.details:
I didn't realize before that it is really hard to code in Vanilla JavaScript. I think it's because that I started using it for creating Backend application. However, it is very hard to use in client side application. It can be very complex to create components of a page especially when trying to create a single page application.

These are my realizations when I try to create one for myself. I see that JS is hard but it allows me to learn more about the language that I always use. Client side and backend applications are two different but interesting things. Now I know why JavaScript has so many frameworks.
